content.description:
Interesting climbing off the ground,(don't use the tree you wanker) leads to a thought provoking crux through a small bulge. 

  A little sumpin, sumpin to warm up on for the New Wave.

climbs.name: Short Wave
climbs.fa: Jimmy Porter, Eric Fazio-Rhicard, Mike Griffis

content.description: An arete climb listed in other sources but not on mountain project.  Worth doing if on Wind Wall and working on lower moderates. Fairly direct. Credit for this route goes to Jimmy Porter, Eric Fazio-Rhicard, and Mike griffis in 1990. Thanks for a good lower moderate in this area.
content.location: West/Southwest Arete pointing at Wind Wall

content.description:
Dos Perras, Spanish for two bitches, is a short, stout climb for the tactician who enjoys less-than-vertical nothingness.  Ascend minimally featured face to gain a small seam that leads to the anchors. 

  While rightfully overshadowed by the classic lines in its midst, Dos Perras offers a good challenge and a change of style. 

  Due to debris from road improvements the first bolt only partially protects the delicate starting sequence.  Caution is recommended and steps such as an observant belayer, clipping directly into a carabiner rather than a quickdraw, and possibly even a stick clip could be considered.
content.location: Dos Perras is located on the south face of Indigo Tower, directly across from New Wave Direct on the New Wave Wall.

content.description: Indigo Tower is the stubby 20-40ft tower between New Wave Wall and Wind Wall.  There are presently three routes on the formation.  Like the tower itself these routes are overshadowed by the neighboring classic lines.
